intro: Tzeltalia esenbeckii, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, adapting to cold and harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, helping to reduce water loss in its arid habitat. Tzeltalia esenbeckii is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens in cooler regions.
